meanings.definition: To surpass in studying or learning.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outstudy her classmates in every subject.
meanings.sent2: I will need to outstudy my competition if I want to win the spelling bee.
meanings.sent3: The student who can outstudy everyone else will be crowned the champion of the science fair.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to outstudy others is like a shining beacon of academic excellence.
meanings.sent5: If you want to outstudy the rest, you must put in the effort and time to succeed.

meanings.definition: To outdo in studying or learning.
meanings.sent1: He always tries to outstudy his friends when it comes to math problems.
meanings.sent2: In order to outstudy the competition, you must stay focused and determined.
meanings.sent3: The race to outstudy each other in the history quiz was intense and exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outstudy others is like a secret weapon in the battle of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: To truly outstudy your peers, you must have a thirst for learning and improvement.
